key_points: Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick, who died from injuries sustained during the January 6 Capitol riot, was memorialized at the U.S. Capitol.
Congressional leaders, including House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, paid tribute to Sicknick in the Capitol Rotunda.
Pelosi praised Sicknick as a patriot whose sacrifice will always be remembered.
Schumer described Sicknick as a good, kind man, highlighting the personal loss felt by many.
Sicknick's family attended the ceremony, alongside members of Congress.
President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden paid their respects to Sicknick on Tuesday night.
A viewing session was held for Capitol Police officers and others to honor Sicknick.
Sicknick's remains were to be buried at Arlington National Cemetery following the memorial service.
Pelosi and Schumer honored Sicknick's heroism on January 6, stating he helped protect democracy.
Brian Sicknick is only the fifth person to lie in honor in the Capitol Rotunda, a recognition of his service and sacrifice.
